thread.title: Ahly's new coach Peseiro arrives in Cairo, to be welcomed Sunday - Egyptian Football - Sports
thread.title_full: Ahly's new coach Peseiro arrives in Cairo, to be welcomed Sunday - Egyptian Football - Sports - Ahram Online

author: english.ahram.org.eg
title: Ahly's new coach Peseiro arrives in Cairo, to be welcomed Sunday - Egyptian Football - Sports
text:
Related Zamalek president slams coach Ferreira after Ahly defeat Winning the Super Cup is just a start for the new season, says Ahly's coach VIDEO: Crisis-hit Ahly ease woes with 3-2 derby win over Zamalek Ahly ready for Zamalek showdown in Egypt Super Cup: Zizo Egypt' Ahly, a model of stability, hit by unfamiliar internal wrangling Ahly chairman promises trophies next season following protest by fans Ahly fans protest appointment of Peseiro as head coach Ahly football club's new coach, Jose Peseiro, arrived in Cairo Friday night. The Portuguese tactician to be officially welcomed at a press conference Sunday.
Last week, Ahly announced the appointment of the former Real Madrid assistant manager as the club's new coach for one season, without disclosing the financial details.
Following their first unsuccessful season since 2004, Ahly management axed manager Fathi Mabrouk and appointed Abdel-Aziz "Zizo" Abdel-Shafi as caretaker manager until the Super Cup.
Zizo guided Ahly to clinch its sole title of the season, the Super Cup, after beating Zamalek 3-2 Thursday.
Peseiro, 55, is set to take charge of Ahly, who lost the domestic double league and cup to Zamalek, starting from the Egyptian league season opener against Talae El-Geish on 22 October.
Peseiro, who failed to take Saudi Arabia to the 2010 World Cup finals, was among several candidates tipped to take the Ahly hot seat before the club confirmed that he would be the new manager following the dismissal of Mabrouk.
Apart from spells at Real Madrid and Saudi Arabia, where he was sacked following a loss to Syria in the Asia Cup in 2011, Peseiro also took charge of Saudi's Hilal, Panathinaikos, Sporting Braga and UAE's Al-Wehda.
His most notable achievement came in 2005 when he led Portuguese giants Sporting to the Europa League final before losing the title to CSKA Moscow.
